CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper October 30, 1965, pg. 23, reads: "Crash Landing - A grounded Ford sedan (above) is examined by onlookers after it soared across Centre Ave on three wheels, plunging into an embankment at the Senior Citizens construction site, last week.  Driver Andrew Brown, 29, of Francis St. was traveling down Francis St. when he lost his left front wheel, which is pictured propped against his car next door to the unseen Courier office building.  Brown was taken to Montefiore Hospital where he was treated for back and neck injuries, and then released."
TitMainTitle: Ford Fairlane car belonging to Andrew Brown smashed into dirt embankment beside construction site with police car in background, Centre Avenue near Francis Street, Hill District
